abstract: Tom Kerridge is cooking some superb British food in his Michelin-starred gastropub.
snippet: Tom Kerridge is cooking some superb British food in his Michelin-starred gastropub.
lead_paragraph: "I do hope the food isn't all fussy," said my friend Edwina as we drove out of London on a beautiful Indian summer afternoon for Sunday lunch at the Hand and Flowers pub in Marlow, which is midway between Maidenhead and Henley-on-Thames in Buckinghamshire. Her slightly grumpy apprehension derived from the fact that Hand and Flowers had just received two Michelin stars, a first for any British pub. "I do loathe the term 'gastropub,'" she added. "I bet this place will be full of horrid people wearing new Barbour jackets and Wellies, and don't forget we must be home by 5 p.m." Now lost in a sea of red wine was last night's admission that she had a date with her married Spanish airline pilot.
